events.body:
Thanks for catching this.  Looks like this was broken in two ways, which is why the test was succeeding in the first place:
- inequality instead of equality, which only didn't cause problems because
- we were comparing a p2p message with its payload (so the inequality condition would trigger, and the wait_until would return)

utACK

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1604,7 +1604,10 @@ def wait_for_getheaders(self, timeout=60):
         assert wait_until(test_function, timeout=timeout)
 
     def wait_for_inv(self, expected_inv, timeout=60):
-        test_function = lambda: self.last_message.get("inv") and self.last_message["inv"] != expected_inv
+        """ Currently only checks the first inv object in an inv message"""
comments.body: In which case you might want to `raise NotImplementedError` if `len(expected_inv) >= 2`?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1604,7 +1604,10 @@ def wait_for_getheaders(self, timeout=60):
         assert wait_until(test_function, timeout=timeout)
 
     def wait_for_inv(self, expected_inv, timeout=60):
-        test_function = lambda: self.last_message.get("inv") and self.last_message["inv"] != expected_inv
+        """ Currently only checks the first inv object in an inv message"""
